info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Catawba, northeastern Lincoln and southwestern Iredell Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Newton, or 4 miles east of Maiden, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Westport, Lake Norman, Denver, Lake Norman State Park, Maiden, Catawba, Sherrills Ford, Terrell and Bandys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
